ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: They will call there for fruit of every kind, in complete security.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: They will call for every kind of fruit with satisfaction.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: While resting in security, they shall call for all kinds of fruit.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: They will be offered all kinds of fruits, in peace and security.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: In it they will ask for all kinds of fruit, with safety.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: They will call therein for every kind of fruit in peace and security;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: They shall call therein for every fruit in security;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: therein calling for every fruit, secure.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: They call therein for every fruit in safety.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: They will call therein for every kind of fruit, in peace and security.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: They will call therein for every kind of fruit in security.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Secure [from any kind of harm,] there they will call for every kind of fruit [they wish].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: There can they call for every kind of fruit in peace and security;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: They will call therein for every kind of fruit in peace and security;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: There in security, they will call for every kind of fruit.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: They will call therein for every kind of fruit, in peace and security.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: They will call therein for every [kind of] fruit - safe and secure.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [44:55] They will call, they will request from servants, therein, that is, in Paradise, to bring, every fruit, thereof, [remaining] secure, [in their knowledge] that it will not come to an end or cause harm and [secure] from all danger (āminīna, ‘secure’, is a circumstantial qualifier’).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (They call therein for) they request in the Garden; and it is also said that this means: they eat in Paradise (every fruit in safety) from death, evanescence or torment.
